content: I am a Ph.D student in the School of Computer Science, The University of Adelaide, supervised by Assoc. Prof. Tat-Jun Chin, Dr. Yasir Latif and Dr. Alireza Khosravian. I am affiliated with Australian Institute for Machine Learning (AIML) and Australian Centre for Robotic Vision (ACRV). My research interest is to develop robust/practical optimisation algorithms for computer vision and robotics application.
summary: I am a Ph.D student in the School of Computer Science, The University of Adelaide, supervised by Assoc. Prof. Tat-Jun Chin, Dr. Yasir Latif and Dr. Alireza Khosravian. I am affiliated with Australian Institute for Machine Learning (AIML) and Australian Centre for Robotic Vision (ACRV).
title: Shin-Fang Ch'ng

title: An example journal article

summary: We proposed a technique which exploit temporal continutity in visual localization. We won the APRS/IAPR best paper award.
title: Outlier-Robust Manifold Pre-Integration for INS/GPS Fusion

summary: We propose an efficient outlier-robust algorithm to tackle INS and GPS sensor fusion problem for pose estimation.
title: Outlier-Robust Manifold Pre-Integration for INS/GPS Fusion

summary: We establish the practicaibility of a robust fitting formulation inspired by Fourier Analysis of Boolean functions and investigate a quantum algorithm to solve the formulation.
title: Quantum Robust Fitting

summary: We propose an efficient algorithm to resolve marker pose ambiguities using rotation averaging.
title: Resolving Marker Pose Ambiguity by Robust Rotation Averaging with Clique Constraints
